channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATACMNS-763] Custom repository implementation class not working as stated in the reference documentation
item.description:
When I use spring-data-jpa 1.8.2 , which depends on spring-data-commons-1.10.2.RELEASE , my custom repository implementation works fine :

public class MyRepositoryImpl<T, ID extends Serializable> extends SimpleJpaRepository<T , ID> implements MyRepository<T, ID> {
 
 
 
  protected Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(getClass());
 
 
 
  private final EntityManager entityManager;
 
 
 
  public MyRepositoryImpl(Class<T> domainClass, EntityManager entityManager) {
 
    super(domainClass , entityManager);
 
    this.entityManager = entityManager;
 
  }
 
}

But when I upgrade my project to spring-boot 1.3.M5 as project's parent , it seems it's depend on spring-data-jpa:jar:1.9.0.RELEASE , and depend on spring-data-commons:jar:1.11.0.RELEASE .

But my custom repository cannot get injected , throws :

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: No suitable constructor found on class destiny.MyRepositoryImpl to match the given arguments: [Ljava.lang.Object;@554188ac
 
	at org.springframework.data.repository.core.support.RepositoryFactorySupport.getTargetRepositoryViaReflection(RepositoryFactorySupport.java:338)

It seems it's from RepositoryFactorySupport inside spring-data-commons-1.11.0.RELEASE :

	protected final <R> R getTargetRepositoryViaReflection(RepositoryInformation information, Object... constructorArguments) {
 
    Class baseClass = information.getRepositoryBaseClass();
 
    Constructor constructor = ReflectionUtils.findConstructor(baseClass, constructorArguments);
 
    if(constructor == null) {
 
      throw new IllegalStateException(String.format("No suitable constructor found on %s to match the given arguments: %s", new Object[]{baseClass, constructorArguments}));
 
    } else {
 
      return BeanUtils.instantiateClass(constructor, constructorArguments);
 
    }
 
  }

There is no such method in spring-data-commons-1.10.2 , but available in spring-data-commons-1.11.0 . Can you check it out ?

Thanks.

BTW , in the 1.9.0.RELEASE document :
http://docs.spring.io/spring-data/jpa/docs/1.9.0.RELEASE/reference/html/#jpa.misc.jpa-context

I cannot find JpaContext in any package ... where is it ?
item.summary: Custom repository implementation class not working as stated in the reference documentation

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Coming from 1.8, your custom RepositoryFactory implementation should override getTargetRepository(…) so that getTargetRepositoryViaReflection(…) shouldn't actually get invoked. However, it looks like you're trying to leverage the new simplified repository base class registration mechanism.

I just realized that the reference docs unfortunately state the wrong constructor to be implemented in case of JPA. The correct constructor is taking JpaEntityInformation and EntityManager. Would you mind trying that?

JpaContext is [here](http://docs.spring.io/spring-data/jpa/docs/1.9.0.RELEASE/api/org/springframework/data/jpa/repository/JpaContext.html).

Hi . My custom RepositiryFactory did implement getTargetRepository . Here is my code :

public class MyRepositoryFactoryBean<R extends JpaRepository<T, I>, T, I extends Serializable> extends JpaRepositoryFactoryBean<R, T, I> {
 
 
 
  protected RepositoryFactorySupport createRepositoryFactory(EntityManager em) {
 
    return new MyRepositoryFactory(em);
 
  }
 
 
 
  private static class MyRepositoryFactory<T, I extends Serializable>
 
    extends JpaRepositoryFactory {
 
 
 
    private final EntityManager em;
 
 
 
    public MyRepositoryFactory(EntityManager em) {
 
 
 
      super(em);
 
      this.em = em;
 
    }
 
 
 
    protected Object getTargetRepository(RepositoryMetadata metadata) {
 
      return new MyRepositoryImpl<T, I>((Class<T>) metadata.getDomainType(), em);
 
    }
 
 
 
    protected Class<?> getRepositoryBaseClass(RepositoryMetadata metadata) {
 
      return MyRepositoryImpl.class;
 
    }
 
  }
 
}

It seems I should re-write getTargetRepository(RepositoryMetadata), but I cannot find sample code , how to correctly implement it ?

OK , I figure it out . This code works :

public class MyRepositoryFactoryBean<R extends JpaRepository<T, I>, T, I extends Serializable> extends JpaRepositoryFactoryBean<R, T, I> {
 
 
 
  protected RepositoryFactorySupport createRepositoryFactory(EntityManager em) {
 
    return new MyRepositoryFactory(em);
 
  }
 
 
 
  private static class MyRepositoryFactory<T, I extends Serializable>
 
    extends JpaRepositoryFactory {
 
 
 
    private final EntityManager em;
 
 
 
    public MyRepositoryFactory(EntityManager em) {
 
 
 
      super(em);
 
      this.em = em;
 
    }
 
 
 
    @Override
 
    protected MyRepositoryImpl2 getTargetRepository(RepositoryInformation information) {
 
      JpaEntityInformation<?, Serializable> entityInformation = getEntityInformation(information.getDomainType());
 
      return new MyRepositoryImpl2<>(entityInformation , em);
 
    }
 
 
 
    protected Class<?> getRepositoryBaseClass(RepositoryMetadata metadata) {
 
      //return MyRepositoryImpl.class;
 
      return MyRepositoryImpl2.class;
 
    }
 
  }
 
 
 
}


public class MyRepositoryImpl2 <T, ID extends Serializable> extends SimpleJpaRepository<T , ID> implements MyRepository<T, ID>  {
 
 
 
  public MyRepositoryImpl2(JpaEntityInformation<T, ?> entityInformation, EntityManager entityManager) {
 
    super(entityInformation, entityManager);
 
  }
 
}
With that repository base class implementation you shouldn't even need the factory implementations anymore but only configure the class to be used in @EnableJpaRepositories(repositoryBaseClass = …).
I've updated the reference documentation and fixed the exception now clearly exposing the types actually expected in the constructor.
